overview_of_class:
This course covers the definition of a function; trigonometric, exponential, logarithmic and inverse
functions; graphs, limits, continuity; derivative of a function; product, quotient and chain rule; implicit differentiation; linear approximation and differentials; related rates; mean value theorems; curve
plotting; optimization problems; Newton's method; and antiderivatives.
name: Differential Calculus of One Variable Functions
title: SCS MATH 220-CN-64 Differential Calculus of One Variable Functions

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
This course covers the definition of a function; trigonometric, exponential, logarithmic and inverse
functions; graphs, limits, continuity; derivative of a function; product, quotient and chain rule; implicit differentiation; linear approximation and differentials; related rates; mean value theorems; curve
plotting; optimization problems; Newton's method; and antiderivatives.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Three years of high school math, including trigonometry, or MATH 113.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
Students will gain an understanding of limits and derivatives, and how to use these ideas to analyze
functions.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value:
Classes will include lectures and group discussions. Homework problem sets will be an essential part
of the course.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Students will be graded on problem sets, quizzes, and midterm/final exams.
